messages.subject: Too many books
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/18/03 4:25:22 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/18/03 4:25:22 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< << (although I haven't yet
convinced the family to let me start running them *perpendicular* to the
wall, in bays, like a library....I dream of this, though. <g>). >>

Keith wanted to do that in our library, and I said NO! Not just no, but
hell
no. FINALLY we have one large floorspace, and I would rather rotate books
in
and out than do that!
>>

Well, I'm no where near Becky's capacity....but then, I have a very small
house (with six bookshelves and a couple of closet shelves full).

Your response to Keith reminded me of what dh said the other night.
We were looking at stuff for the house and I sighed and said "I need another
bookshelf".
He looked at me funny and replied "You don't need another bookshelf, what you
need is a MATCH!"
Don't worry, he got a slug in the arm....:)

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
